block.p: Joan Hodson Mullen, a daughter of Joan and T. David Mullen of Quogue, N.Y., was married on Friday to Gabriel Andrew Smith, a son of Sarah Mead Smith and Dr. Marcus A. J. Smith of New Orleans. The Rev. Michael Bartlett, an Anglican priest, performed the ceremony at the Collegiate Church of St. Endellion in St. Endellion, England.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Tulane University, where they met.

Joan Hodson Mullen, a daughter of Joan and T. David Mullen of Quogue, N.Y., was married on Friday to Gabriel Andrew Smith, a son of Sarah Mead Smith and Dr. Marcus A. J. Smith of New Orleans. The Rev. Michael Bartlett, an Anglican priest, performed the ceremony at the Collegiate Church of St. Endellion in St. Endellion, England.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Tulane University, where they met.

Ms. Mullen, 31, will continue to use her name professionally. She was a dancer with Perspectives in Motion, a dance company in New York. This month, she will start teaching children modern dance in a program sponsored by the New Orleans Recreation Department and the New Orleans Ballet Association.

Mr. Smith, 36, is an architect for Eskew Plus, an architectural firm, and the owner of Nodesign, a custom furniture design business, both in New Orleans. He is also an adjunct professor of architecture at Tulane. He received a master's degree in architecture from Harvard University.
